content.rendered:
💣 Troublemaker Strain – Photoperiod Feminized Seeds by Tastebudz Syndicate

Unruly, Unmatched, and Unforgettable – Meet the 27% THC Powerhouse

Previously available only in exclusive bundles, the Troublemaker strain has earned its cult status and is now available as an individual release by popular demand. Developed from Dirty Cash and Triple Kush, this indica-dominant photoperiod strain is all about deep potency, complex flavour, and balanced effects.

With 27% THC, strong yields, and a rich sour-berry terpene profile, Troublemaker is designed for experienced collectors and growers who want a hard-hitting, flavour-loaded addition to their lineup.

📊 Troublemaker Strain Specs

Feature Details
Genetics Dirty Cash x Triple Kush
Strain Type Indica-Dominant Photoperiod Feminized Seeds
Flowering Time 8+ Weeks
Indoor Yield High (dense, resinous buds)
THC Content Up to 27%
Flavours Sour berries, citrus tartness, earthy kush
Aromas Fruity, tangy, sweet-skunky
Effects Euphoric, relaxing, mentally uplifting

🍇 Flavour & Aroma of the Troublemaker Strain

The Troublemaker strain offers a standout flavour profile driven by its sour berry roots. On the inhale, expect a sharp tang of tart fruit balanced by subtle earthy and sweet notes on the exhale. It’s a bold, flavour-forward experience that lingers — one of the most distinct terpene profiles in the Tastebudz Syndicate collection.

🧠 Effects: Euphoric Head, Relaxed Body

Don’t let the name fool you — this 27% THC strain is all about good vibes. The Troublemaker strain hits fast with an uplifting, euphoric onset that clears the mind and boosts creativity. As the high evolves, a deep body relaxation settles in, perfect for winding down without full couchlock.

It’s a great choice for creative sessions, evening relaxation, or relieving stress while staying alert and motivated.

🌿 Growing the Troublemaker Strain

Troublemaker is a photoperiod strain that performs equally well indoors or outdoors, thanks to its hardy genetics and balanced growth traits. With a flowering time of around 8+ weeks, growers can expect dense, trichome-heavy buds with strong visual appeal and a powerful aroma.

It’s an ideal strain for growers seeking potency, resilience, and complex flavour in one compact plant. Whether you’re a beginner or an expert, the Troublemaker strain is built to reward.

❓ Frequently Asked Questions About the Troublemaker Strain

1. What is the Troublemaker strain?
Troublemaker is a feminized photoperiod cannabis strain bred from Dirty Cash and Triple Kush. It’s known for its 27% THC, sour berry flavour, and balanced hybrid effects.

2. Is the Troublemaker strain good for beginners?
Yes. Although it’s high in THC, it’s relatively easy to grow thanks to its resilience and strong structure — making it suitable for indoor and outdoor setups.

3. What does the Troublemaker strain taste like?
Expect sour berries, citrus tang, and earthy kush undertones — a bold and fruity profile for flavour chasers.

4. How long does Troublemaker take to flower?
Troublemaker flowers in around 8+ weeks, rewarding patient growers with dense, resin-rich buds.

5. What kind of high does Troublemaker deliver?
A euphoric, mentally uplifting buzz followed by soothing body effects. Ideal for stress relief, mood elevation, or winding down creatively.

✅ Why Choose the Troublemaker Strain?

With its bold terpene profile, impressive 27% THC content, and crowd-favourite lineage, the Troublemaker strain is one of the most well-rounded options in the Tastebudz lineup. It’s a great fit for flavour chasers, experienced smokers, and collectors building a top-shelf photoperiod lineup.

If you’re looking for a strain that brings the fire — without sacrificing complexity or charm — Troublemaker is your perfect partner in crime.

⚖️ Legal Disclaimer (UK Customers)

Cannabis seeds are sold strictly as adult souvenirs. Germination or cultivation of cannabis seeds is illegal in the UK without a government-issued license. Please check your local laws before purchasing. Tastebudz Syndicate encourages responsible and lawful use.
